page.title: 10INNS
page.content:
The{Crown and Cushion}at 834572 is a public house in Minley which is owned by the Grand Metropolitan chain. It serves bar meals and is popular among business people and military personnel from the local barracks. It was originally called the 'Cushion' but the Crown Jewels were rumoured to have been stolen and hidden there in the seventeenth century. It is a meeting place for local clubs including the Sandhurst & Yateley Hunt and organises social functions.
The{Ely Hotel,}822590, has a restaurant, a grill, and a public bar which are very popular. It is named after a racehorse. An inn stood near this site in Tudor times. This building is about fifty years old.
